intro: Loasa amabilis, commonly known as the sweetflower loasa, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in spring and summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a velvety texture. Loasa amabilis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
